profileText: A Representative from Indiana; born in Kentucky, birth date unknown; was graduated from an academy in Kentucky; studied law; was admitted to the bar and practiced in Vincennes and Princeton, Ind.; judge of the Knox County Circuit Court, 1817, 1818, and 1822-1824; elected as a Jackson Republican to the Eighteenth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative William Prince (December 23, 1824-March 3, 1825); died in Frankfort, Ky., April 20, 1826.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by death of William Prince, and took his seat December 23, 1824.
